attributes.action: Ban the Sale and Use of Fireworks by the General Public
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks cause significant distress and harm to pets, wildlife, and vulnerable people. Loud explosions and bright flashes can terrify animals, pollute the environment, and pose risks of injury and fire in neighbourhoods. Restricting fireworks to controlled public events would allow celebrations to continue safely, while protecting communities, animals, and the environment from unnecessary harm.
attributes.background: Make it illegal to sell fireworks to the general public and ban their use in residential areas. Fireworks should only be available to licensed organisers for use at approved public events.

rejection.details:
Limit the sale of fireworks to those running local council approved events only
